<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">venerable institutions were being 
            <choice>
              <sic>critisiced</sic>
              <corr>criticised</corr>
            </choice>. But the public</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-glob" key="Globe, The">Globe</rs> and the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-rose" key="Rose, The">Rose</rs> could not feel as the public in the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>i9th</sic>
              <corr>19th</corr>
            </choice> 
            <choice>
              <sic>cent ry</sic>
              <corr>century</corr>
            </choice> felt when <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-ghos" key="Ghosts">Ghosts</rs> was acted that old humbugs</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were being shown up; and the rottenness of society.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">After all, when country squires must call in <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs> to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">express their meaning, prose was not yet serviceable;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the critical spirit had no proper tool.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And in fact the dramatists were not [depicting?]</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del hand="ms">So</del> Anonymity thus lay over the <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-bank" key="Bankside">Bankside</rs><!-- come back to this... --></l>
